website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon Df full-frame SLR camera lives half in the modern world and half in the analog era, and suffers a bit for it.
pros: Full compatibility with older manual focus Nikkor lenses
cons: Lacks focus assist beam and flash
Retro design and chunky body clash
Modern focus screen not ideal for manual focus lenses
Shallow handgrip not a great match with larger lenses

customer_reviews.title: It's a a camera with a very modern sensor for people who like to shoot photos only
customer_reviews.text: I got this specifically for the sensor and controls. I have no interest in video on needs for 51 points of autofocus. I learned how to shoot on a Minolta from the 70's. The control's are not cumbersome nor confusing. The camera is built specifically for people who learned to shoot using film. The nature of photography for me is getting artistic photos and archival purposes of art work. If you're looking for a camera that does it all, this is not for you. It's a a camera with a very modern sensor for people who like to shoot photos only. The sensor produces beautiful photos and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Splendid camera but the status reported is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The status was not as published. Major scratches at the bottom and sides, the cover of the synchro port is missing and the cover of the viewfinder cover as not included. The camera is fantastic but definitely is not in the status that was published.
customer_reviews.author: José M. Ramírez

customer_reviews.title: This camera is one sweet tool. It brought me so many memories of ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is one sweet tool. It brought me so many memories of the film days. I love the low light capability of the camera. The pictures I get are absolutely on point as expected. No regrets whatsoever. Everywhere I take this camera, it causes a lot conversation due to its retro look, so it is a great talking piece as well. Not bad among a group of photographers.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Perez

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews, glad I bought one.
customer_reviews.text: The more I use this camera, the more I like it. Not needing the D810 for everything, this is a great choice for everyday photographs. The retro style is a walk down memory lane for those of us that used FE's, FM's and F4's
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: If you like film cameras and want that experience in digital by ...
customer_reviews.text: If you like film cameras and want that experience in digital by this NOW. We shoot shows, and use it in studio. Using Nikon's excellent lenses, some from the 60 & 70's our results are outstanding. Nikon should get an award for this one. Make more like it!
customer_reviews.author: Great Western

customer_reviews.title: He's highly satisfied and happy to be using his old lenses
customer_reviews.text: this camera is everything my husband thought it would be. He's highly satisfied and happy to be using his old lenses. He does love the new lens that came with this camera. Definitely worth adding.
customer_reviews.author: B. Foerst

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent digital camera for taking pictures (no video) that I like very much.
customer_reviews.author: Kemal Gursoy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and lovely styling
customer_reviews.text: A great camera that works well with a number of manual focus lenses that I have. I love the look and style especially the silver color. A great addition to my camera list which takes wonderful photos.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M.

customer_reviews.title: My df dslr
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the dslr looks great and shot some great low light shots already with it
customer_reviews.author: christovel maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Df for old fashioned photography
customer_reviews.text: Slow autofocus. Great manual controls which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: noname

customer_reviews.title: the low light handling on this thing is amazing. The smaller body makes it more portable that ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow.....my first full frame and wow...the low light handling on this thing is amazing. The smaller body makes it more portable that the other full frames I looked at. Like the retro styling too. Wish it had a small pop up flash just to add a little fill in some situations and to avoid carrying an attachment but that is my only gripe since the low light handling is so strong.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and feel.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the look and feel of this camera. The tactile sensation of manipulating knobs to set shooting parameters rather than menus, menus, menus gets me more in touch with creating an image. I recommend the silver body rather than the black - the retro look of it takes me back in time. I give this my heartiest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: NC Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Df: best of 2 worlds.  Awesome sensor with retro controls.
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite fond of the old school analog dials/ergonomics and particularly excited that Nikon has incorporated one of the best low-light sensors currently available into this model. I'm a professional still photographer-not videographer- so I have no issue with Nikon ignoring video capture on the Df. At least 50% of my work involves low-light scenes and this camera performs well, even at 12,800 ISO. It appears to me that some of the reviewers who have criticized this camera have probably never owned/operated the predecessors that this body resembles.
customer_reviews.author: dimini

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a light dslr ff camera and the df fits very well. Pictures are awesome and I don't regret paying so much.
customer_reviews.author: Ilan Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Does what I want, the way that I want it to.
customer_reviews.text: The direct-dial controls on the Nikon Df are effective, intuitive, and convenient for my photography, which is mainly contemplative. The image quality and the file size are ideal for my projects. This camera's technical speed and capabilities far exceed my needs. In the instant of releasing the shutter, I do not need X frames per second; I want to know what to anticipate in the one image. The Nikon Df delivers competently and does not leave anything to uncertainty except my imagination or skills. It turns out to be my ideal DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera. Great image quality and excellent noise characteristics. It takes me back to my early days in photography.
customer_reviews.author: Maestro Vecchio

customer_reviews.title: Great still camera
customer_reviews.text: A photographer's camera, great external controls like my old FM-2. Great higher ISOs freer of noise.
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: Professional Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures. I've been playing around with the settings and testing picture results. I also have other lenses from my previous Nikon cameras that I can continue to use. Yeah!! I'm still learning about all of the features, but it's really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle or Teresa White

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Df DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Was shipped lightening fast. Just as described. Highly recommend this product to photographers especially those who got their start using film
customer_reviews.author: Mo Momma

customer_reviews.title: Retro Looks meets Everything you need in a camera.
customer_reviews.text: Why five stars you ask, because it's everything I wanted to camera. Looking for that old school feel but can't sacrifice modern technology, this is your camera.
customer_reviews.author: Natchez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camara
customer_reviews.text: Great balance, weight and feature set. Outstanding low light sensors allow cranking up of the ISO to 6400 indoors and still have best resolution ever from a digital camera I have ever used. Wish it was a little less costly as I think the price point is too high for the masses and also wish there was a way to transfer wirelessly the photos to my iPad. The Nikon Wireless Mobil Adapter does not support iPads.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera for pictures.
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely amazing camera. If you are looking to take the most amazing pictures possible or are dealing with low light scenarios, this camera is it. It uses the same sensor as Nikon's top of the line camera and only lacks the DSP (and therefore does not shoot video). If you are a photographer that doesn't shoot video, go for the sensor as there is no substitute for this quality and light sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stetson

customer_reviews.title: Nikon, please don't cut corners on a purest camera.
customer_reviews.text: -Very uncomfortable grip -Can't focus in the dark as well as even my D700 -Awkward with large primes -Two handed with zooms -Flash controls are menu based -Other controls require you to not only use two hands but also look down. -Shutter actually jammed a few times and had to take the battery out! Really, really wanted to like this one but it has too many cut corners in the design. Returned in frustration. Pros: lightweight, fast, and takes beautiful photos. Would work well for a considered slow moving portrait photographer. Live view is also really awesome and snappy.
customer_reviews.author: UndeadTribble

customer_reviews.title: Low-light wonder....
customer_reviews.text: Tremendous low-light capabilities. Excellent image quality due to the D4 processor. Great "feel". No video (yes, that is a plus for me). Nice build quality. All of the hype talks about the nice retro styling and the return of dials on the top of the body. It's true! Best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: MrBill54

customer_reviews.title: Takes some time
customer_reviews.text: It takes a few days to get to know the camera, but after that, it is pure photography. Try manual mode with auto ISO. The knobs will make perfect sense.
customer_reviews.author: B. K Joosten

customer_reviews.title: Df in favour of D800
customer_reviews.text: I will sell my d800 and convert to Df. I take more pictures with this, it us lighter and still more pro
customer_reviews.author: Jan Kauffmann

customer_reviews.title: Nikon DF
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the coolest camera I have ever shot is definitely worth the money no matter what people say about the cost it's definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Gearold McCoy
